name: osteopathic

relating to the treatment of injuries to bones and muscles using pressure and movement: He could improve posture with osteopathic treatment.
In the United States and Canada, osteopathic medicine is a system of medicine that emphasizes the care of the whole person, using the latest scientific treatments and also sometimes treating injuries to bones and muscles using pressure and movement: Osteopathic medicine takes a holistic approach to the human body, treating it as a unit of interrelated systems working together for good health. Physicians graduate from either an allopathic or osteopathic medical school. See also

(of a doctor) trained in osteopathic medicine: Osteopathic doctors (DOs) are different from allopathic doctors (MDs). Osteopathic physicians are calling on schools to ban carbonated soft drinks. See also
